title: How Ambedkar’s amendment led to the creation of the Election Commission
summary1: Bhimrao Ramji Ambedkar is considered the key architect of the Indian Constitution . He is credited with the creation of the Election Commission, an independent body mandated to hold elections to the office of President and Vice President, and Lok Sabha, state assembly, Rajya Sabha and state legislative council polls . The EC came into being on January 25, 1950, a day before India became a Republic . summary2: Bhimrao Ramji Ambedkar is considered the key architect of the Indian Constitution . He is credited with the creation of the Election Commission, an independent body mandated to hold elections to the office of President and Vice President, and Lok Sabha, state assembly, Rajya Sabha and state legislative council polls . The EC came into being on January 25, 1950, a day before India became a Republic . Draft Article 289 proposed separate election commissions for the Centre and the states . It also proposed separate commissions for each state or province . The new Article 324 proposed by him made the poll machinery centralised by having a singular poll authority for holding state and national elections . It gives the EC "plenary powers" to conduct elections and prepare electoral rolls. The Supreme Court has on various occasions upheld these powers. title: Gold prices ease from record high after Donald Trump's tariff exemptions

title: Telangana megalithic stones feature in tentative list of Unesco world heritage sites

There are close to 80 tall standing stones of 10 to 14 feet height, accompanied by nearly 3,00 alignment stones related to the funerary rights of the ancient community .
summary2: The megalithic menhirs, the mysterious standing stones dating back to 3,000 years, are most likely to be included in the UNESCO World Heritage Sites in India . There are close to 80 tall standing stones of 10 to 14 feet height, accompanied by nearly 3,00 alignment stones related to the funerary rights of the ancient community . According to the dossier submitted to the UNESCO, the site offers an insight into the perspective the ancient builders might have had as they carefully aligned the stones with celestial bodies, marking the solstices, equinoxes, and star patterns, thereby establishing the site as an ancient observatory . The site, dating back approximately 3,400 years, showcases the culture, traditions, and astronomical knowledge of the original inhabitants through its megaliths .

The massive avalanche hit the Border Roads Organisation (BRO) camp between Mana and Mana Pass between 5:30am and 6am on Friday, burying workers inside eight containers and a shed . The workers were engaged in a strategic road project connecting Mana, the last Indian village, to Mana Pass on the China border . The total number of workers affected by the avalanche has been revised to 54 from the previously reported 55 .

summary1: Manoj Bhandari was resting inside one of the eight containers at the Border Roads Organisation (BRO) campsite near Mana village in Uttarakhand’s Chamoli district early Friday morning . summary1: The avalanche hit the Border Roads Organisation (BRO) camp between Mana and Mana Pass between 5.30am and 6am on Friday, burying 55 workers . Thirty-three of them were rescued by Friday night, with the operation suspended as darkness fell . The desperate search for the remaining four continued in treacherous conditions at the remote site located at an elevation of approximately 3,200 metres . More than 200 personnel, six helicopters, and ground-penetrating radar equipment have been deployed in what officials describe as a “war footing” operation .
